description.narrative: CP PCR 7 IR7.6: By 2017, governments and civil society have strengthened capacity to provide children and families with improved access to child and family welfare and child justice services to prevent and respond to violence, abuse and exploitation, including in emergencies., which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Child Protection Systems (including Justice and Police, child and family social services, health and education and communities) provide improved quality of and access to services for the prevention of and response to violence, abuse and exploitation of children at all times.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: CP PCR 7 IR7.6: By 2017, governments and civil society have strengthened capacity to provide children and families with improved access to child and family welfare and child justice services to prevent and respond to violence, abuse and exploitation, including in emergencies.

description.narrative: Fiji and Nauru improved inter-agency coordination in referring child protection cases. In the Republic of Marshall Islands, Child Protection in Emergencies training and birth registration reached children in remote drought-affected atolls. In Samoa, children in need of special protection were supported by non-governmental service providers and police commenced diversion measures. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of PICs with inter-sectoral referral protocols to ensure service provision for victims of violence

actual.value: 2017:1 Fiji (Inter-Agency Guidelines on Child Abuse and Neglect 2015)

title.narrative: Existence of free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration in accordance with national legal requirements

actual.value: 2017:In 8 of 11 countries with information available, birth registration is free within a time frame but birth certificate is issued for a fee, and late registration and certificate carry fees.

title.narrative: Number of PICs with over 60% coverage with formal birth registration.

actual.value: 2017:8 PICTs Samoa: 65% (DHS 2014), Fiji, Palau, Tuvalu no DHS data, but estimated over 60% from CRVS routine data
